comments:
With eclipse-sdk-I20070320-0100-win32 on WinXP, Sun 1.5.0_11:

Help > Software Updates > Find and Install > Search for New Features
  Add new Remote Site, Next
  Select a feature to install, next
  Select the install location, click "Add extension locations"
    In the browse dialog, select an existing directory, OK
    Press "Add.." again, in the dialog create a new directory, press OK
    Now select the previously added location, click "Remove"

--> Observe following two NPE's:

Created an attachment (id=61610)
Patch with the fix

Verification FAILED:

With I20070321-1800 on Windows XP SP1, Sun 1.5.0_11 the original NPE is gone, but a different one now occurs making things actually worse than before (see attachment). On close observation, the problem seems to be this:
- UM dialog has location "ext" selected
- Adding new location "ext2" is OK
- Adding new location "ext3" now changes the dialog which is hidden in the 
  background: instead of "ext" it now holds "ext2", although the OK button
  was not pressed in the "Select extension location" dialog
- Removing "ext2" now is invalid, because the UM dialog hidden in the 
  background uses this one for its current selection

--> When the "Select Extension Location" dialog is now closed, the dialog 
  which was hidden before now becomes visible, with an invalid selection.
  User has no chance to do any further actions, every action leads to 
  another NPE

--> Workaround: Press "back" in wizard, then "Next" again --> selection is
  re-initialized with a valid extension location.

With I20070321-1800 on Linux RHEL4-gtk, Sun 1.6.0, the same happens though I only got the first NPE there.

Created an attachment (id=61662)
.log file with NP exceptions during verification

Attached .log file shows the new exceptions on verification.

First one is
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.TargetPage$JobViewerSorter.compare(TargetPage.java:186)

Second one is
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.TargetPage.updateStatus(TargetPage.java:479)
*** Bug 178777 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The implementation of the 'Change Location' dialog was bad. It was adding and removing configured sites directly in the model. I reworked it by creating a temp. working copy and delayed commit until 'OK' was pressed. It seems to be working well now and the wizard behind the dialog is not changed until OK is pressed.
